verses.roman:
bhūñā hāsi' kahe,--"āmi jāniyāchi pahile
asta mohara haya tomāra sevaka-āṅcale

synonyms: bhūñā—the landlord; hāsi'-smiling; kahe—said; āmi—I; jāniyāchi—knew; pahile—before this; aṣṭa mohara—eight golden coins; haya—there are; tomāra—your; sevaka-āṅcale—in the pocket of the servant.
translation: Smiling, the landlord said, "Before you offered them, I already knew that there were eight gold coins in your servant's possession.
